summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 discussing the scheduling of interviews with potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It involves coordination between an FBI Victim Specialist and other parties regarding the logistics of meeting with victims in Miami and West Palm Beach, Florida.

persons.name: Victim Specialist
persons.context: The sender of the email footer, identified as a Victim Specialist at the FBI Miami Headquarters and Homestead Resident Agency, responsible for coordinating services for potential victims.

persons.name: Case Agent
persons.context: Mentioned as the agent who is traveling to Florida and has scheduled victim interviews for Thursday, July 11, 2019.

connections.description: They are coordinating on the Epstein case regarding victim interviews and services, as the Victim Specialist references speaking to the Case Agent.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interviews
events.description: Interviews with potential Epstein victims were scheduled to take place, with one at 11 AM and another at 3 PM.

events.title: Coordination for Victim Services
events.description: Email correspondence indicates ongoing coordination to provide services to potential Epstein victims in West Palm Beach and Miami, with the Case Agent traveling to Florida.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively scheduling and conducting interviews with potential Epstein victims in Florida in July 2019.
A Victim Specialist and a Case Agent were coordinating victim services and interview logistics.
The email chain demonstrates the FBI's operational response and victim support efforts following the renewed investigation into Epstein.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and covered by privacy laws, indicating the sensitive nature of the victim information.
